description: Assesses use of the five senses in descriptive writing

levels.4: Uses at least 3 different senses (see, hear, feel, smell, taste) with specific details
levels.3: Uses 2 different senses with some details
levels.2: Mostly uses one sense, usually sight

feedback_stems.strength: You used multiple senses! I noticed
feedback_stems.growth: Try adding what you can hear, smell, taste, or feelâ€”not just what you see

levels.4: Uses specific, vivid words that create clear pictures in the reader's mind
levels.2: Words are basic and general (nice, good, big)

feedback_stems.strength: I loved your specific words like
feedback_stems.growth: Replace general words like 'nice' with specific words that help readers picture it

levels.4: Sensory details work together to create a clear picture or feeling
levels.3: Most details relate to each other
levels.2: Some details seem random or disconnected

feedback_stems.strength: Your details worked together to create a clear picture
feedback_stems.growth: Choose details that all help describe the same thing or feeling
